definition: all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice/same as 光說不做|光说不做[guang1 shuo1 bu4 zuo4]
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: He is all talk and no action.
But the gifted Daniel scholar shouldn't be an armchair strategist.
sentences.chinese: 不過你這個牛才子也不能光說不練吧。

sentences.english: Like Saif Gaddafi, Dr Sadiki says, Ibrahim spoke the language of democracy although "the practice is something else".
sentences.chinese: 像卡扎菲一樣，他有着民主的言論，儘管光說不練。

sentences.english: All talk and no action is useless.
So that tells me they are all talks and no action.
sentences.chinese: 所以那個告訴我他們都是光說不練假把式。

sentences.english: Frieda: Baby, I think you're all yap and no zap.
sentences.chinese: 寶貝兒，我覺着你是光說不練啊。
